department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Purchase of (various vessels) on Campobello Island in NB
description: Disposal of 25 various vessels in Campobello Island, NB
full_summary:
## Tender Announcement: Disposal of 25 Vessels at Campobello Island, New Brunswick

### Solicitation Information

* **Reference Number**: PW-MER-005-28860
* **Solicitation Number**: F5419-230001/A
* **Publication Date**: November 21, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: November 23, 2022 2:00 PM EST
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Amendment Date**: November 22, 2022

### Contract Opportunity

The Government of Canada seeks a supplier for the disposal of 25 various vessels in Campobello Island, New Brunswick. The trade agreements that apply to this opportunity include CETA, WTO-AGP, CPTPP, CFTA, FTAs with Peru, Colombia, Panama, Korea, and UK.

### Qualification Requirements

To be considered, suppliers must hold a Supply Arrangement (SA) under the Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) EVC01-202004/A or be able to meet the qualification requirements.

### Requirements

* Removal of vessels from current location: February 1, 2023
* Completion of work and all deliverables: February 15, 2023

### Evaluation Criteria

The lowest price will be the evaluation criterion for this opportunity.

### Contact Information

* Name: Andrea Major
* Email: [andrea.major@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:andrea.major@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (403) 796-3230

### Terms and Conditions

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Request for Debriefing

Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation. Bidders should make the request to the Contracting Authority within 15 working days from receipt of notification that their bid was unsuccessful. The debriefing may be provided in writing or by telephone.
